idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

descript.abstract: United States Institutions is a point theme representing common institution landmark types including hospitals, educational institutions, religious institutions, government centers, and cemeteries in the United States. Attribute information includes the name and FCC code of the institution. This dataset is a part of the 2010 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States Institutions provides the locations for hundreds of thousands of hospitals, educational institutions, places of worship, government offices, cemeteries, museums, and libraries. Each institution is named and shows the state and county it resides in.
descript.supplinf:
Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:50,000.
This dataset includes an ESRI layer file symbolizing the features.

citeinfo.title: United States Institutions, 2010
citeinfo.origin: Economic and Social Research Institute (Reston, Va.)

For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent the locations within the United States for common institution landmark types including hospitals and polyclinics; educational institutions, including schools, colleges, and universities; places of worship, including churches, synagogues, and mosques; government offices; cemeteries; museums; and libraries.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-digit number) for the state in which the institution is located combined with the FIPS code (three-digit number) for the county in which the institution is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The official name of the institution.
The Feature Classification Code of the institution.
The feature type description of the institution.
The MultiNet feature code of the institution.
The length of the text in the NAME attribute.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI® software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the ESRI Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.

srcinfo.srccitea: Tele Atlas MultiNet North America v. 2010.03
Tele Atlas Dynamap Census Boundaries v. 11.0

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted the Points of Interest data sets from Tele Atlas MultiNet North America v. 2010.03 and merged them into a nationwide data set. Selected the institution features. Renamed field FEATTYP to MNFC. Added field FCC and calculated its values based on MultiNet FEATTYP equivalents. Added field FEATTYPE and copied its values from MultiNet FEATTYP descriptions. Added field TEXTLENGTH and calculated its values to the length of the text in the NAME field. Added the STCTYFIPS field and coded it by overlaying on 2009 Data Update U.S. Counties. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is dependent on geographic area. In most areas, accuracy is between 5 and 25 meters (16 and 82 feet). In some areas, accuracy is off by up to several tens of meters (100 feet or more). In the poorest areas, accuracy is off by up to 100 meters (328 feet).

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either tools in ArcGIS or ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2). The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
